Treat your #BPO (outsourcing) relationship like a partnership, not just a tactic to save money. Extend as many of your internal benefits to your externally-sourced agents. This is critical for your #CX. Wonderful wisdom from Frances Brittingham via @calm @zendesk #CXMoment

Agree with @jennysuedempsey here. We need to keep having this conversation in the #contactcenter world. #CXMoment

When you know your customers well and have your employees use your product, you can begin to anticipate customer needs and tailor your self-service to meet those needs. ~Frances Brittingham via @calm @zendesk @solvvy #CXMoment

At @Calm, #custserv agents are empowered to share about their own mental health journey as they interact with customers who are on their own journey. This human to human connection is so important. #CXMoment

I love this analogy. @Calm is the @Nike of the mind. Great point! When running shoes came about, they were here to stay. I agree that mental fitness is here to stay...and that's a very good thing. #CXMoment
.@zendesk offers @calm to all of their employees? What a great idea for businesses to drive wellness, mental health, and engagement among their employees. #CXMoment
Thanks to @solvvyinc and @Zendesk, customer growth has actually outpaced ticket volume for @calm amid significant growth. That's the power of AI-driven self-service. #CXMoment
As @calm #custserv agents interact with "stressed-out" customers, they get to be an extension of the app for those customers. #CXMoment

As we listen to Frances Brittingham, I'm so struck by the way different businesses have been impacted by the pandemic. @Calm was uniquely positioned to help make a difference. But that also means huge growth and operational changes to scale quickly. #CXMoment
Oh my goodness. If you could pick any actor to read you a bed time story, who would it be? @calm sounds amazing! #CXMoment

@toister @Scottywerner1 We've talked about this. Early on I was enamored with the (good) viral WOW stories online but so often that's PR and we forget about the unsung work of consistently doing a great job and solving problems. Our team definitely celebrates the WOWs that happen but it's not our focus.

@Scottywerner1 @toister I once worked at a company where we provided incredible, WOW-quality service to people looking to sign up and we neglected our existing customers. I choose consistently good over WOW any day of the week. 

And from the customer's perspective, consistency IS often WOW.
